title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
Developer Guide
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

Install nbdev_hello_world in Development mode
# make sure nbdev_hello_world package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to nbdev_hello_world
$ nbdev_prepare

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/esquaredly/nbdev-hello-world.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c esquaredly nbdev_hello_world
or from pypi
$ pip install nbdev_hello_world


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repository’s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.

title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
How to use
Fill me in please! Don’t forget code examples:

1+1

2

title: Quarto Basics
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Quarto Basics
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis
